docs.abstract: Primary elections are being pushed back. The Olympics are officially in 2021. The election-year calendar seemed set in stone and now it is up in the air.
docs.snippet: Primary elections are being pushed back. The Olympics are officially in 2021. The election-year calendar seemed set in stone and now it is up in the air.
docs.lead_paragraph: There is a rhythm to it all, in happier times, a procession of dates and checkpoints to spread the politics and patriotism neatly across the calendar.

headline.print_headline: With Political Calendar In Flux, Can We Expect An Election in November?

docs.abstract: Bernie Sanders said lots of new voters would show up and vote for him on Tuesday. He was half right.
docs.snippet: Bernie Sanders said lots of new voters would show up and vote for him on Tuesday. He was half right.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. I’m Lisa Lerer, your host.

docs.abstract: With the odds of winning long, some Democrats wonder why Bernie Sanders is still in the presidential race. He’s still pushing his agenda, though it’s not clear who’s listening.
docs.snippet: With the odds of winning long, some Democrats wonder why Bernie Sanders is still in the presidential race. He’s still pushing his agenda, though it’s not clear who’s listening.
docs.lead_paragraph: Both hands were waving — over here, over there, a full wingspan on display — as Bernie Sanders directed his most biting sarcasm at his “Republican friends.”

headline.main: As Coronavirus Crisis Unfolds, Sanders Sees a Moment That Matches His Ideas
headline.print_headline: Sanders Sees Crisis as a Match for His Ideas

docs.abstract: As the coronavirus rages, Americans’ views of President Trump have risen slightly to reach record highs, polls show. But he remains polarizing.
docs.snippet: As the coronavirus rages, Americans’ views of President Trump have risen slightly to reach record highs, polls show. But he remains polarizing.
docs.lead_paragraph: With the United States now leading the world in confirmed coronavirus cases, Americans finally agree across party lines that the threat can’t be ignored.

headline.main: Can Trump Break a 50 Percent Approval Rating?
headline.print_headline: Voters Believe in Fighting Viral Threat, but Are Split Over Trump’s Response

docs.abstract: Joe Biden’s campaign and top donors are racing to reimagine the ways they raise money as worries grow that the coronavirus could choke off contributions from donors big and small.
docs.snippet: Joe Biden’s campaign and top donors are racing to reimagine the ways they raise money as worries grow that the coronavirus could choke off contributions from donors big and small.
docs.lead_paragraph: Joseph R. Biden Jr. is working the phones with top donors while cloistered in his Delaware home. His digital team is searching for the right tone to ask small contributors for cash during the sharpest economic downturn in their lifetimes. And his finance operation is plotting how to keep the checks coming when catered parties for big contributors are on hold — indefinitely.

headline.main: Biden Faces a Cash Gap With Trump. He Has to Close It Virtually.
headline.print_headline: Biden Campaign Faces Cash Gap at a Fragile Moment

docs.abstract: Despite the president’s slow performance on the coronavirus and his series of falsehoods, some independent voters and Democrats are giving him a measure of credit for his handling of the crisis.
docs.snippet: Despite the president’s slow performance on the coronavirus and his series of falsehoods, some independent voters and Democrats are giving him a measure of credit for his handling of the crisis.
docs.lead_paragraph: Justin Penn, a Pittsburgh voter who calls himself politically independent, favored Joseph R. Biden Jr. in a matchup with President Trump until recently. But the president’s performance during the coronavirus outbreak has Mr. Penn reconsidering.

headline.main: Who Are the Voters Behind Trump’s Higher Approval Rating?
headline.print_headline: During Crisis, Trump’s Approval Gets Boost From Crucial Voters

byline.original: By Trip Gabriel and Lisa Lerer

docs.abstract: In an interview with Seth Meyers on “Late Night,” Bernie Sanders said that raising consciousness on the issues he cares about is an argument for continuing his campaign.
docs.snippet: In an interview with Seth Meyers on “Late Night,” Bernie Sanders said that raising consciousness on the issues he cares about is an argument for continuing his campaign.
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Bernie Sanders this week offered his clearest articulation to date of his rationale for remaining in the Democratic presidential primary despite Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s commanding delegate lead, arguing that a “narrow path” remains for his candidacy and that it’s important for him to keep pushing his liberal agenda.

headline.main: Sanders Argues He Has ‘Narrow Path’ and Says He Wants to Push His Issues
headline.print_headline: Sanders Argues He Still Has ‘Narrow Path’

docs.abstract: The death toll mounts as House Democrats consider their next move: This is your morning tip sheet.
docs.snippet: The death toll mounts as House Democrats consider their next move: This is your morning tip sheet.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Deborah Birx, the White House’s coronavirus response coordinator, spoke on Tuesday as President Trump and Dr. Anthony Fauci listened.

headline.main: On Politics: The Country Keeps Reeling

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (2020)

docs.abstract: Unite the Country, a super PAC supporting Mr. Biden’s campaign, and the progressive group American Bridge are hoping to raise about $175 million together to defeat President Trump.
docs.snippet: Unite the Country, a super PAC supporting Mr. Biden’s campaign, and the progressive group American Bridge are hoping to raise about $175 million together to defeat President Trump.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Two of the most prominent outside Democratic groups are forming a partnership to pool resources and research to help elect former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. this fall, an attempt at consolidating fund-raising in an increasingly competitive marketplace for third-party organizations.

headline.main: 2 Top Democratic Groups Form Alliance to Support Joe Biden
headline.print_headline: 2 Democratic Groups Form Alliance to Aid Biden

byline.original: By Jonathan Martin and Shane Goldmacher

docs.abstract: TV optics and a virtual campaign: This is your morning tip sheet.
docs.snippet: TV optics and a virtual campaign: This is your morning tip sheet.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump inspected a coronavirus testing kit during Monday’s briefing at the White House.

headline.main: On Politics: Does Biden Need to Turn the Flash On?
